result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John James Schultz

records.addlTxt: Matter set for a PTC on 12/05/2022 at 9:30 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John James Schultz in court.  Attorney Joseph Edward Long JD in court for John James Schultz.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CM-29, 22CM-66, 22CM-128 and 22CM-180.

11:00 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matters are set for Defense motion for modification of bond. 
Court received the motion. 
Atty Long addresses the Court, explains further. 

State proposes that Defendant only test on court dates. 
State is okay with this suggestion.

Atty Long concurs, this is accurate.

Court addresses Defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Court amends bond so that Defendant is not required to participate in the pretrial supervision program but is required to go for testing at the Justicepoint program on court dates only. 
This bond modification is only on 22CM-180. 

Case is set for a pretrial conference next.
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 10/07/22
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 09/16/22
Matter set for a PTC on 10/31/2022 at 10:00 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion for Change of Bond Conditions filed by Atty Joseph Edward Long JD (sent to Br 3 Judge on 08/25/22 sp)
Violation Report from JusticePoint dated 08/24/22
Matter set for a PTC on 09/12/2022 at 10:00 a.m. - Offer has been extended
Pre-trial conference on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Letter from O.M.S dated 05/09/22 in re:  request for the "no contact" be changed to "no violent or abusive contact" filed by Atty Joseph Edward Long JD
Defendant Record Update
Matter set for a PTC on 07/11/2022 at 10:30 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter from K.C.S. dated 04/19/22 in re:  request to have the "no contact" changed to "no violent or abusive contact"

4/27/2022: Bond modified to: Court will modify each of the bonds that there is not to be contact with OMS and KCS unless they consent in writing and copies of consent to be forwarded to DA's office and Clerk of Courts so it is in the court file and if they consent, there is not to be any violent or abusive contact and they, both, would need to develop a family safety plan at the family crisis center. KCS has already consented in writing. /s/TTF

Previous conditions:
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No contact with OMS and KCS or residence stated on the record.

Defendant John James Schultz in court.  Attorney Joseph Edward Long JD in court for John James Schultz.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard at this time are 22CM-29 and 22CM-66.

2:01 PM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances.

Matters are set for the Defendant's bond modification hearing.

Atty Long addresses the Court, requests that bond conditions in both parties, to no abusive contact. Defense would have no objection to a family plan being put in place.
Atty Long provides copy of letter from victim KCS to State and Court. 

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
There is no victim here that wish to give a statement.
State has not discussed this motion with the victim.

State would not oppose only if family safety plan is filed and approved contact by victim OMS.
Atty Long addresses the Court.

Court addresses living arrangements.
Defendant explains. 
Parties live in separate places.

Court reviews original conditions of bond as well. 

BY THE COURT:
Court will modify each of the bonds that there is not to be contact with OMS and KCS unless they consent in writing and copies of consent to be forwarded to DA's office and Clerk of Courts so it is in the court file and if they consent, there is not to be any violent or abusive contact and they, both, would need to develop a family safety plan at the family crisis center. KCS has already consented in writing.
Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:26 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John James Schultz in court.  Attorney Joseph Edward Long JD in court for John James Schultz. 
Both files heard: 22CM29, 22CM66

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Atty Long requests a bond modification and states the basis for his request.  Requests no violent or abusive contact.  
Court questions if the family members are present in the courtroom. 
Atty Mutchler doesn't believe so. 
Court states the issue would be that the victims are to be provided notice.  Court is unable to hear the motion without notice to the victims and suggests that if the victims support the motion, that they submit correspondence indicating that they have no objection to the proposed modification.  
Atty Mutchler makes statements, if that was the request of the victim, they would not object.  But that is not the information that was provided to them. 
Court asks Atty Long to schedule the matter. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

Atty Mutchler states there was cash was posted in 22CM66 but state requests no contact conditions be added.   
Atty Long states there is already a no contact with K.C.S. and would not object because they have to file a motion.  The address and business name stated are his own and would do harm to the defendant.  
Court questions the parties regarding the business. 
Atty Long responds. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court sets conditions in 22CM66
No contact with the family member referenced in the bond in the other case (22CM29)
Bond is set at $500 signature bond in 22CM66 until the bond is amended, those will be the conditions of the new bond. 

Court notes cash was posted and the cash will be continued. 
Atty Long request the court repeat the order. 

BY THE COURT: 
22CM66 - Bond is set at $500 cash with same conditions as in 22CM29. 


Pre-trial date is set without the presence of Atty Long.  If the date doesn't work, contact
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion for Change of Bond Conditions filed by Atty Joseph Edward Long JD (sent to Br 2 JA on 03/03/22 sp)
filed by Atty Joseph Edward Long JD

Initial Appearance set for February 28, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. No contact with OMS and KCS or residence stated on the record.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA)  Andy Mutchlerappears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty)  Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

1:06 PM Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of disorderly conduct, criminal damage and possession. 
Atty Soule states that Defendant is not eligible for representation from public defender.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  February 28, 2022  @ 1:45 p.m.  in Branch 1
